meanings.definition: To make someone extremely angry or impatient.
meanings.sent1: Her constant interruptions would infuriate him during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the neighbors' party started to infuriate the old man.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten seemed to have a talent to infuriate the grumpy old dog.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam seemed to infuriate time itself.
meanings.sent5: The careless mistake in the important document would infuriate the boss beyond measure.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become extremely angry or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: The long wait at the doctor's office began to infuriate the tired patients.
meanings.sent2: The constant ringing of the phone started to infuriate the receptionist.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel would infuriate the grumpy old cat by stealing its food.
meanings.sent4: The relentless rain seemed to infuriate the gloomy clouds above.
meanings.sent5: The repeated mistakes in the project plan would infuriate the meticulous project manager.
